title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on 30 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: a fire has broken out at st bede 's school in cambridge .
the secretary of state for communities and local government is in wisbech to discuss turning it into a `` garden town '' .
cambridgeshire county council will reduce opening hours at its libraries to save £ 2m .
more news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: that 's it from the cambridgeshire live team for today .
we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow with the latest news , sport , travel and weather for the county .
do n't forget you can get involved by sending us your stories and .
at any time via email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: wisbech garden town : mp steve barclay says 'there 's a strong business case ' for reopening train line
text: wisbech mp steve barclay has told me `` we 're making real progress '' with plans to reopen the town 's railway line .
it 's an essential part of the `` garden town '' development proposals outlined by communities and local government secretary greg clark ( middle ) during his visit to fenland earlier .

mr barclay ( far left ) says employers , councils and schools have all come together to give a `` strong business case '' for the line - which would not only offer affordable housing to cambridge workers but attract people who want to live and work in wisbech .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: weather : showers possible , but clear skies means a chilly night
text: it 'll be rather a cloudy evening , with the risk of showers in the first part of the night .
drier later with clear spells and a cold night .
minimum temperature : 0c ( 32f ) .
thursday should start cold , with a touch of frost even , then a fine , dry morning with sunny spells .
maximum temperature : 12c ( 53f ) .
for the latest forecast where you live , go to bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: communities secretary says 'devolution wo n't be forced on anyone '
text: east anglian devolution will not be forced on anyone who does n't want it , according to communities and local government secretary greg clark who has been visiting the region today .
but mr clark , who was looking at proposals for a new garden town for wisbech , also suggested the scheme , which has a lot of local support , would happen more quickly if devolution was in place .
his plans to give norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire extra powers and a directly elected mayor have come in for criticism since they were announced a fortnight ago .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: headlines : devolved east anglia needs elected mayor , says government minister new fire chief is acting boss chris strickland
text: the headlines for cambridgeshire this afternoon :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: 'first ' history of the english channel in the 18th century published by cambridge historian
text: renaud morieux teaches british history at cambridge university , which tweets he 's written the first book on the history of the english channel in the 18th century
water joins as well as divides - identity , sovereignty & the 'english ' channel

documents.title: firefighter finds 'novel way of packing equipment '
text: the agility displayed by a cambridgeshire firefighter is something to behold in this tweet
firefighter jasper vidot has found a novel way of packing away equipment .
# springclean
@ twitterid hi guys - we love your video !
i wonder if you would be happy with us re-posting it on our social channels please ?
many thanks !
@ twitterid please do , happy for you to re-post
@ twitterid thanks so much !

documents.title: library hours to be cut as county council 's budget squeezed
text: huntingdon and ely 's libraries will no longer open on sundays as part of a raft of opening hour changes announced by cambridgeshire county council .
the changes will save £ 700,000 , says the council , and are necessary after further reductions in government funding come into force from 25 april .
march , st neots and wisbech libraries will all reduce their opening hours , while a decision has yet to be taken about opening times for st ives ' library .
author: Alex Harris
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: new fire chief chris strickland 'brings innovative solutions '
text: cambridgeshire 's new fire chief chris strickland says he is `` thrilled '' to continue to work with the county 's `` dedicated '' fire and rescue staff .
mr strickland has been temporarily in charge of the service since january .

sir peter brown , chairman of cambridgeshire and peterborough fire authority , said : `` chris has been chosen to bring innovative solutions and to continue to drive forward the organisation , while striving to deliver the best service we can . ''

documents.title: wisbech : fenland 's deprivation levels 'getting worse '
text: fenland district council is hopeful that developing wisbech as a garden town will help it tackle fenland 's deprivation levels .
the council says the district is now ranked the 80th most deprived local authority out of 326 authorities - in 2004 it was ranked 142 .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: mayor 'essential ' to east anglian devolution plans
text: as well as discussing the garden town plans for wisbech , i 've been speaking to minister greg clark about the government 's proposal to devolve powers to an `` east anglian powerhouse '' .

mr clark ( right ) told me that if the government was going to hand billions of pounds of transport money to the region , it needed to be handed to a mayor with a mandate - and not to `` a committee whose members may change from month to month '' .
norfolk and suffolk county councils want to go ahead with a devolved east anglia , but cambridgeshire county council said changes are needed before it could sign up .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: peterborough company in line for national award
text: a rapidly growing tenant referencing company in peterborough is among the front runners to up a major honour .
good news !
# peterborough company in line for national award - # cambridgeshire # cmblive
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: wisbech garden town : flood mitigation essential to proposals
text: flood mitigation would be another key feature of the garden town proposal for wisbech .
the majority of the land earmarked for up to 10,000 new homes is in flood zone 3 - which means it has a high probability of flooding or is flood plain .
as we locals know , wisbech is surround by land which needs constant pumping and drainage to prevent it reverting back to wild and boggy fen .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: wisbech garden town : reaction from residents
text: i spoke to people in wisbech yesterday about the proposal to turn it into a garden town - and got mixed reactions .
most people told me infrastructure would be key and backed the plans for the return of the railway station with lines to ely , cambridge and beyond .
but one man said he reckoned it was all talk .
`` they 've been going on about doing things here for years , but it never happens , '' he told me .
author: Sara Varey
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: wisbech : a domesday book town with anti-slavery connections
text: after proposals for a garden town were put forward , what do we know about wisbech ?
source : a history of wisbech

documents.title: chris strickland confirmed as cambridgeshire 's new fire chief
text: cambridgeshire has a new chief fire officer .
chris strickland has been the county 's assistant chief fire officer since 2007 , having previously worked for hertfordshire fire service since he was 18 .
cambridgeshire and peterborough fire authority made the decision to approve mr strickland 's appointment today after `` a competitive assessment process last week '' .

documents.title: weather : showers could develop later
text: weather watcher `` crowland lincs '' snapped this fantastic sunny morning at turves .
but we 're being warned that showers could develop later , with highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
for a more detailed weather forecast where you live , go to bbc weather .

documents.title: headlines : garden town proposal outlined for wisbech thieves steal essential supplies from cambourne 's foodbank
text: these are the stories we 're leading with in cambridgeshire at lunchtime :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: wisbech 'garden town ' : regeneration 'key ' to expansion proposal
text: greg clark has been visiting wisbech this morning - and hearing that regeneration of wisbech 's georgian town centre is a key aspect of the `` garden town '' proposals .
the secretary of state for communities and local government has been shown around by mp steve barclay .
up to 10,000 new homes could be built under the plans .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: st bede 's to open as usual after easter holidays following fire
text: i 've spoken to a staff member at st bede 's inter-church school in cambridge who said the school is putting plans in place to reopen as scheduled after the school holidays .
the fire broke out in a classroom in the technology building , but did not spread to other parts of the birdwood road campus .
staff and parents have been emailed about the incident .
cambridgeshire fire and rescue has begun an investigation into the cause of the blaze .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: can the garden town proposal be a 'game-changer ' for wisbech ?
text: well , that 's the hope of fenland district council .
house price differences between cambridge and wisbech is one of the key reasons put forward by the district council for this garden town proposal .

but for this to go ahead there would need to be a substantial investment in infrastructure - including a £ 111m rail link between wisbech and cambridge and a £ 430m a47 dual carriageway to peterborough .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: minister greg clark arrives in wisbech to talk about his 'garden town ' proposal
text: i 'm in wisbech this morning where government minister greg clark has just arrived to talk about a proposal to transform the town .
the secretary of state for communities and local government ( left ) was met by the town 's mp steve barclay ( right ) .
the plans involve building 10,000 new homes and a train link to cambridge to create a new `` garden town '' .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : lorry , van and two cars crash on a421
text: one lane is blocked and there 's queuing traffic on the a421 eastbound before the black cat roundabout , on the bedfordshire-cambridgeshire border .
it 's because of an accident involving a lorry , van and two cars .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : a sunny but chilly start with showers later
text: the day begins chilly but will be largely dry with some sunny spells .
expect showers to develop later .
maximum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
for an up-to-date forecast where you live , go to bbc weather .
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Weather

documents.title: fire crews starting to leave scene of school fire
text: fire engines have begun leaving st bede 's school in cambridge .
author: Julia Greenaway
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: headlines : firefighters tackle a blaze at st bede 's school in cambridge garden city and rail link proposal to transform wisbech
text: here are the stories we 're leading with this morning :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: st bede 's fire now 'under control '
text: cambridgeshire fire and rescue service has just sent us a statement about the fire at st bede 's school in cambridge .
a spokesman said the fire , which was in a classroom on the ground floor of the two storey building , is now `` under control '' and crews are making the area safe .
firefighters from cambridge , burwell , linton , huntingdon and bury st edmunds attended this morning 's blaze .
author: David Webster
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: school fire was 'well developed ' on arrival
text: station commander stuart smith told me the st bede 's school fire was `` well developed '' by the time the first crews arrived , and they called for more resources to extinguish it and protect adjacent buildings .
the fire in a classroom was fully under control by 08:00 .
author: Julia Greenaway
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: fire-hit school currently closed for easter
text: what we know so far :
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: st bede 's inter-church school fire : a smell of smoke in the air
text: i 'm currently at the scene of a fire at st bede 's inter-church school in cambridge , but if it was n't for the emergency crews on site you may not necessarily know
there 's no flames that i can see , but you can smell smoke in the air .
i can see four fire engines and police have cordoned off the local area , but no-one has yet told me much more about what 's going on .
some teachers who turned up to the school gates have been told to go home .
author: Julia Greenaway
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: video : st bede 's inter-church school fire
text: here 's some video from the scene of the fire at st bede 's inter-church school in cambridge .

documents.title: st bede 's inter-church school fire : photos from the scene
text: firefighters are currently tackling a blaze at a school in cambridge .
the fire broke out at about 06:00 at st bede 's inter-church school on birdwood road .

documents.title: welcome to cambridgeshire live
text: apologies for the late start this morning - the gremlins have been inside our computers - but they 've now been destroyed and we 're up and running to bring you the latest cambridgeshire news , sport , weather and travel until 18:00 .
coming up - news about a school building on fire in cambridge .
in the meantime feel free to get in touch with your stories and to us via email , facebook or twitter .
author: David Keller
BBC News
